wesm commented on issue #6647: ARROW-8103: [R] Make default Linux build more minimal
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6647#issuecomment-600903068
 
 
   @nealrichardson to make sure I'm understanding, if an average Linux user types `install.packages(c("arrow))` what will be installed? A minimal C++ library with no thirdparty libraries (and no jemalloc)? 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on issue #6647: ARROW-8103: [R] Make default Linux build more minimal
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6647#issuecomment-600959381
 
 
   @wesm without any env vars set, you won't get any compression libraries or jemalloc, but all of the other features that the R package relies on (parquet, compute, etc.) are built. See https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/c75673c88b3fc4fc666cb0edb2cb3b126a29ce50/r/inst/build_arrow_static.sh#L46-L85. So, not quite "minimal", and not exactly "no thirdparty libraries" because it will still build boost_ep, rapidjson_ep, and thrift_ep. 
   
   I didn't think it was worth the trouble to start turning off arrow features for this lighter build because it would negate the benefit--you'd still have to reinstall the package to do most things you'd want to use `arrow` for. And I'm told that install time isn't a blocking issue for CRAN. Turning off the thirdparty libraries does help with install time, in case it were to become an issue (you never know), but probably just as important it reduces risk of spurious errors like the ones we saw where bzip2 was failing to download. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #6647: ARROW-8103: [R] Make default Linux build more minimal
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6647#issuecomment-600963525
 
 
   OK. Since jemalloc makes a big difference in performance in many cases, if it's not burdensome I would include it in the default build if possible

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description: So that we can build on CRAN as quickly as possible, and thus make the default experience for users installing the package better--no environment variable required to get something functional.
fields.summary: [R] Make default Linux build more minimal
